<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[93, 277, 230, 292]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 277, 904, 292]]<|/det|>
9709/11  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[93, 301, 308, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 1 Pure Mathematics 1  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[770, 301, 904, 316]]<|/det|>
May/June 2025  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[757, 325, 904, 340]]<|/det|>
1 hour 50 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[93, 355, 393, 370]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[93, 384, 392, 399]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 222, 432]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 434, 880, 636]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 665, 212, 678]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 681, 728, 712]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 75.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[433, 72, 562, 85]]<|/det|>
BLANK PAGE

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 81, 99, 98]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 76, 603, 104]]<|/det|>
1 Solve the equation \(6 \sin \theta=1+\frac{2}{\sin \theta}\) for \(-180^{\circ}<\theta<180^{\circ}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 83, 99, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 76, 918, 131]]<|/det|>
2 The equation of a curve is such that \(\frac{\mathrm{d} y}{\mathrm{~d} x}=4\left(2 x-5\right)^{3}-9 x^{\frac{1}{2}}\). The curve passes through the point \(A\left(4,-\frac{11}{2}\right)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 144, 144, 161]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 141, 611, 160]]<|/det|>
(a) Find the gradient of the normal to the curve at the point \(A\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 483, 144, 500]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 482, 398, 500]]<|/det|>
(b) Find the equation of the curve.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 72, 99, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 74, 918, 107]]<|/det|>
3 The third term of a geometric progression is 18 and the sum of the first three terms is 26 . It is given that the common ratio is negative.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 121, 144, 138]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 120, 841, 138]]<|/det|>
(a) Find the tenth term of the progression. Give your answer correct to 3 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 737, 144, 754]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 737, 633, 754]]<|/det|>
(b) Find the exact value of the sum to infinity of the progression.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 72, 99, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 71, 97, 88]]<|/det|>
4

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[292, 91, 704, 308]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 320, 875, 355]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curve with equation \(y=5 x^{\frac{3}{2}}-20 x\) and the line with equation \(y=x-16\). The \(x\)-coordinates of the points of intersection of the curve and line are 1 and 16 .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 369, 630, 386]]<|/det|>
Find the area of the shaded region between the curve and the line.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 72, 99, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 74, 144, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 74, 918, 106]]<|/det|>
5 (a) Find the first three terms, in ascending powers of \(x\), in the expansion of each of the following expressions.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 121, 185, 138]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[188, 120, 267, 138]]<|/det|>
(i) \((2-p x)^{5}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 343, 188, 360]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 336, 270, 363]]<|/det|>
(ii) \(\left(1-\frac{1}{2} x\right)^{4}\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 565, 144, 581]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 559, 918, 604]]<|/det|>
(b) Given that the coefficient of \(x^{2}\) in the expansion of \((2-p x)^{5}\left(1-\frac{1}{2} x\right)^{4}\) is 93 , find the possible values of the constant \(p\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 77, 99, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 78, 918, 110]]<|/det|>
6 The equation of a curve is \(2 x^{2}-k x y+2=0\) and the equation of a line is \(y=p x+3\), where \(k\) and \(p\) are constants.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 125, 144, 141]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 123, 918, 155]]<|/det|>
(a) Given that \(k=2\) and \(p=11\), find the coordinates of the points of intersection of the curve and the line.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 75, 144, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 74, 918, 107]]<|/det|>
(b) Given instead that \(p=4\), find the set of values of \(k\) for which the curve and the line do not intersect.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 82, 99, 98]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 76, 465, 106]]<|/det|>
7 The equation of a curve is \(y=4 x^{2}+\frac{9}{x^{2}}-8\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 123, 144, 139]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 121, 918, 152]]<|/det|>
(a) A point \(P\) is moving along the curve in such a way that its \(y\)-coordinate is decreasing at 5 units per second.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 168, 737, 185]]<|/det|>
Find the rate at which the \(x\)-coordinate of point \(P\) is changing when \(x=2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 75, 144, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 74, 811, 91]]<|/det|>
(b) Find the coordinates of the stationary points of the curve and determine their nature.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 77, 99, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 76, 900, 97]]<|/det|>
8 The circle with equation \(x^{2}+y^{2}-6 x+10 y-27=0\) intersects the line \(x=-2\) at the points \(P\) and \(Q\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 108, 868, 128]]<|/det|>
Find the area of the triangle formed by the tangents to the circle at \(P\) and \(Q\), and the line \(x=-2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 72, 99, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>9</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 71, 97, 88]]<|/det|>
9

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[337, 87, 660, 252]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 268, 918, 304]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows a sector \(A B C\) of a circle with centre \(A\) and radius \(r \mathrm{~cm}\). The angle \(B A C\) is \(\alpha\) radians, where \(0<\alpha<\frac{1}{2} \pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 318, 144, 335]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 316, 887, 335]]<|/det|>
(a) It is given that the area of the triangle \(A B C\) is \(4 \mathrm{~cm}^{2}\) and the area of the sector \(A B C\) is \(8 \alpha \mathrm{~cm}^{2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 348, 490, 366]]<|/det|>
Find the exact area of the shaded segment.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 84, 144, 101]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 76, 918, 128]]<|/det|>
(b) It is given instead that the length of the chord \(B C\) is \(\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}} r \mathrm{~cm}\) but the area of the triangle \(A B C\) is still \(4 \mathrm{~cm}^{2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 140, 828, 158]]<|/det|>
Find the area of the shaded segment. Give your answer correct to 3 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[82, 72, 116, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[124, 74, 405, 91]]<|/det|>
10 The functions f and g are defined by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[364, 101, 630, 123]]<|/det|>
\[
\mathrm{f}(x)=\sqrt{x} \quad \text { for } x \geqslant 0 \\
\mathrm{g}(x)=3 \sqrt{x+2}-5 \quad \text { for } x \geqslant-2
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 166, 144, 183]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 165, 918, 198]]<|/det|>
(a) Describe fully a sequence of transformations which transforms the graph of \(y=\mathrm{f}(x)\) to the graph of \(y=\mathrm{g}(x)\). You should make clear the order in which the transformations are applied.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[207, 583, 797, 848]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 860, 452, 878]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the graph of \(y=\mathrm{g}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 892, 144, 908]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 890, 826, 909]]<|/det|>
(b) On the diagram sketch the graph of \(y=\mathrm{g}^{-1}(x)\) together with any relevant mirror line.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 78, 144, 95]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 76, 395, 95]]<|/det|>
(c) Find an expression for \(\mathrm{g}^{-1}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 358, 144, 375]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 355, 336, 375]]<|/det|>
(d) State the range of \(\mathrm{g}^{-1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 448, 343, 466]]<|/det|>
<pre>The function h is defined by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[395, 476, 603, 496]]<|/det|>
<pre>\[
\mathrm{h}(x)=x-2 \quad \text { for } x \geqslant 0
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 510, 144, 527]]<|/det|>
<label>(e)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 508, 366, 527]]<|/det|>
(e) Find the value of \(\mathrm{g}^{-1} \mathrm{~h}(4)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 726, 144, 743]]<|/det|>
<label>(f)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 724, 631, 744]]<|/det|>
(f) Explain why the composite function \(\mathrm{h g}^{-1}\) cannot be formed.

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[432, 72, 567, 88]]<|/det|>
# Additional page  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 102, 918, 135]]<|/det|>
